forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 10pm, then a chance of rain showers. Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. West northwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfurls in Downtown San Francisco, a gentle dance of sun and clouds plays across the sky. The forecast hints at the possibility of rain, lingering just beyond the horizon, while the temperature hovers around a brisk 56 degrees—a reminder of the city's ever-changing moods. The soft brush of west winds carries the scent of moisture, whispering of gusts that will soon make their presence known. The current air is a fusion of crispness and anticipation, with a 30% chance of a light drizzle adding a delicate veil to the day.

As evening approaches, expect a slight chance of rain showers before 10 PM, followed by scattered clouds that threaten to shroud the landscape in shadow. With temperatures dipping to about 46 degrees, a warm, layered attire will be your best companion—perhaps a cozy sweater under a well-worn jacket to fend off the chill. The atmospheric clarity is partially obscured, hinting at a distant marine layer, providing a muted canvas for the vibrant cityscape, and setting the stage for a quiet stroll along the waterfront or a leisurely visit to a local café, where warmth and conversation can weave comfort into the brisk night air.
